original_title: Ai yo jinrui to tomo ni are - Zenpen: Nihon hen
overview: The three-hour Ai yo jinrui to tomo ni are / Love, Be with Humanity (1931) starts as a satire of alienation in the world of money, develops into a lumberland epic with a forest fire on Sakhalin Island, turns into a tragedy of King Lear dimensions, and manages to amaze the blasé audience with a happy end in the Wild West.
title: Love, Be with Humanity: Part 1
